contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Nihongo|'''''Imakagami'''''|今鏡|}} (also called {{nihongo|'''''Shokuyotsugi'''''|続世継||lit. "the following generation"}}, or {{nihongo|'''''Shōkagami'''''|小鏡||lit. "small mirror"}}) is a [[Japan]]ese [[historical tale]] written in the late [[Heian period]]. According to its preface, it was written during the reign of [[Emperor Takakura]], in the 2nd year of the [[Kaō (era)|Kaō]] era (1170).<ref name="brownlee">{{cite book |last1=Brownlee |first1=John S. |title=Political Thought in Japanese Historical Writing: From Kojiki (712) to Tokushi Yoron (1712) |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=P1OZUmnLTdoC&dq=Imakagami |accessdate= January 30, 2013 |year=1991 |publisher=[[Wilfrid Laurier University Press]] |location=[[Waterloo, Ontario]], [[Canada]] |isbn= 0-88920-997-9 |pages= 52-57 |chapter= Introduction: Imakagami }}</ref> The book is credited to [[Fujiwara no Tametsune]].<ref name="faure">{{cite book |last1=Faure |first1=Bernard |title=The Power of Denial: Buddhism, Purity, and Gender |url= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |format= |accessdate= January 30, 2013 |date=February 10, 2003 |publisher=[[Princeton University Press]] |location=[[Princeton, New Jersey]], USA |isbn=0691091714 |page=404 }}</ref> It is the second of the four mirror series and is some years following ''[[Ōkagami]]''. While providing a glimpse into life in the royal court of the Heian period, it has been criticized for "ignoring [the] political reality" of the court.<ref name="brownlee"/> It is a sequel to ''Ōkagami''<ref name="brownlee"/> and is set in 1025-1170<ref name="faure"/> from the reign of [[Emperor Go-Ichijo|Emperor Go-Ichijō]], in the 2nd year of [[Manju (era)|Manju]] and ending with the Emperor Takakura's reign. The tale is supposedly by a fictitious grandson of Ōyake no Yotsugi who was visiting [[Hasedera]] of [[Sakurai, Nara|Sakurai]], in [[Nara, Nara|Nara]]. ==See also== * ''[[Ōkagami]]'' * ''[[Mizukagami]]'' * ''[[Masukagami]]'' ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:1170s books]] [[Category:Heian period]] [[Category:Late Old Japanese texts]]
